column3: Data structure for representing arrays of records
column4: Data structure that compactly stores bits
column5: An array in which most of the elements have the same value
column6: An array in which memory is allocated in run time

column2: When do you use a sparse array?
column3: When there are unique elements in the array
column4: When the array has more occurrence of zero elements
column5: When the data type of elements differ

column2: What is the difference between a normal(naive) array and a sparse array?
column3: Sparse array can hold more elements than a normal array
column6: A naive array is more efficient
